Tanks

Class App

  • java.lang.Object
    • processing.core.PApplet
      • Tanks.App
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants

    public class App
extends processing.core.PApplet
    The main class representing the Tank game application. This class extends the PApplet class provided by the Processing library.

    • Method Detail

      • settings

        public void settings()
        Settings method to initialize the window size.
        Overrides:
        settings in class processing.core.PApplet

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Setup method to initialize game resources and elements.
        Overrides:
        setup in class processing.core.PApplet

      • loadTerrain

        public void loadTerrain(java.lang.String fileName)
        Loads terrain data from a text file and populates the terrain array. Each character in the text file represents a cell in the terrain array. 'X' represents a filled cell, while other characters represent empty cells. The terrain array is a 2D grid representing the game's terrain layout.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The path to the text file containing terrain data.

      • transfer

        public void transfer()
        Transfers terrain data from the 2D char array to a 1D integer array. The 1D array stores the height of each column in the terrain grid. Each filled cell ('X') in the terrain grid contributes to the height of the corresponding column. The method assumes that the terrain array has already been populated with data.

      • smoothTerrain

        public void smoothTerrain()
        Smooths the terrain data to create a more visually appealing terrain. This method calculates the average height of each 32-cell segment and sets all cells in the segment to that height. It iterates over the terrain data and replaces each segment with its average height. The method assumes that the terrain data has been transferred to the terrain_new array.

      • loadLevel

        public void loadLevel()
        Method to load next level. Loads level resources and terrain layout from the configuration file.

      • repairPowerUp

        public void repairPowerUp()
        Provides a repair power-up to the current tank player if they have enough score points. If the player's tank health is below 80%, it increases the health by 20 points. If the health is already 80% or more, it increases the health to 100%. Deducts the required score points from the player's score.

      • fuelPowerUp

        public void fuelPowerUp()
        Provides a fuel power-up to the current tank player if they have enough score points. Increases the player's tank fuel by 200 units. Deducts the required score points from the player's score.

      • parachutePowerUp

        public void parachutePowerUp()
        Provides a parachute power-up to the current tank player if they have enough score points. Increments the number of parachutes available to the player. Deducts the required score points from the player's score.

      • teleportPowerUp

        public void teleportPowerUp()
        Activates a teleportation power-up for the current tank player if they have enough score points. Allows the player to select an X coordinate to teleport their tank to. Deducts the required score points from the player's score.

      • airStrikePowerUp

        public void airStrikePowerUp()
        Initiates an airstrike power-up for the current tank player if they have enough score points. Allows the player to select an X coordinate to launch the airstrike at. Deducts the required score points from the player's score.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(processing.event.KeyEvent event)
        Method to handle keyboard inputs. Responds to key presses for tank movement, shooting, power-ups, etc.
        Overrides:
        keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet
        Parameters:
        event - The KeyEvent object representing the key press event.

      • removeTank

        public void removeTank(int i)

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased()
        Method to handle key releases. Responds to key releases for stopping tank movement, etc.
        Overrides:
        keyReleased in class processing.core.PApplet

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(processing.event.MouseEvent e)
        Method to handle mouse presses. Responds to mouse clicks for using power-ups, etc.
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class processing.core.PApplet
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent object representing the mouse press event.

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(processing.event.MouseEvent e)
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class processing.core.PApplet

      • drawTerrain

        public void drawTerrain(java.lang.String color)
        Draws the terrain grid on the screen using the specified color. Each filled cell in the terrain grid is represented as a rectangle. The color parameter determines the fill color of the rectangles.
        Parameters:
        color - The color in which the terrain grid should be drawn.

      • drawSprites

        public void drawSprites()
        Draws game sprites such as trees and tanks on the screen based on the terrain layout. Trees and tanks are positioned according to their coordinates in the terrain grid. Tree sprites are drawn at random x-coordinates within each terrain cell.

      • displayScore

        public void displayScore()
        Displays the final scores of all players at the end of the game. The scores are displayed in a scoreboard format with player names and scores. The winning player's name is also highlighted.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.lang.String color)
        Sets the fill color used for subsequent drawings on the screen. The color parameter should be specified as a string in the format "R,G,B". R, G, and B represent the red, green, and blue components of the color, respectively.
        Parameters:
        color - The color string in the format "R,G,B".

      • setColorLight

        public void setColorLight(java.lang.String color)

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Method to update the game state and perform game logic for each frame. This method manages tank movements, shooting, power-ups, terrain updates, etc.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Method to draw game elements on the screen. Renders terrain, tanks, trees, HUD, etc.
        Overrides:
        draw in class processing.core.PApplet

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tank> getTanks()

      • getTerrain

        public int[] getTerrain()
